events.message: Customer reported an auto accident involving a rear-end collision at a traffic light junction.
The claim was categorized as an 'Auto Accident' after reviewing the initial report and vehicle details.
An insurance claims agent was assigned to handle the case and reach out to the claimant for further details.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer the process will begin promptly.
Requested necessary documents including police report, photographs of damage, and driverâ€™s license copy from the claimant.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including a detailed police report and vehicle damage photos.
The investigation team started examining the details of the collision and verified the authenticity of submitted documents.
Investigation concluded confirming the claimant was not at fault and damages were consistent with the reported accident.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental car reimbursement was proposed and communicated to the customer.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt settlement proposal and clarity of communication.
Claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement proposal by the claimant.
Payment was issued directly to the auto repair shop to cover the vehicle damages as per the approved claim.
The claim was formally closed after payment disbursement and confirmation that repairs started as scheduled.
All claim documents and case files were archived for future reference and record keeping compliance.
